author: Edgar Thompson
title: Suspended Gators QB Will Grier 'really, really sorry' for taking banned substance
text:
Suspended Gators QB Will Grier 'really, really sorry' for taking banned substance Gators QB Will Grier tears up discussing his suspension 
Florida Gators quarterback Will Grier is overcome with emotion during a press conference discussing his season ending suspension. 
Florida Gators quarterback Will Grier is overcome with emotion during a press conference discussing his season ending suspension. Edgar Thompson Contact Reporter Orlando Sentinel Grier suspended one calendar year for failing test for performance-enhancing drug 
Fighting back tears, Florida quarterback Will Grier struggled to put into words his emotions surrounding his one-year suspension for using a substance banned by the NCAA. 
Grier, a redshirt freshman, needed 60 seconds to say just 47 words, pausing to compose himself and his thoughts several times. 
The ashen-faced Grier finally concluded, "I'm really, really sorry to everyone. Just really sorry." 
Coach Jim McElwain then stepped in, put his right arm around Grier's shoulders and pulled him close before the young quarterback walked off. 
Grier told reporters he had taken an over-the-counter supplement and failed to check with the school's medical staff beforehand. 
"I really hope that people can learn from this, learn from my mistake," he said.
